result.execSummary:
The defendant Colby Bertell Burr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Colby Bertell Burr in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further is not needed.

Defendant Colby Bertell Burr in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, 2 Letters from Renew Counseling.

Defendant Colby Bertell Burr in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 20 DAYS time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.
AS TO COUNT 3
The court sentenced the defendant to 2 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time (as to each count), STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program, if approved this may be completed in individual counseling if approved by agent.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with Joeann S. or Frank S. unless approved by court or agent, except for 3rd party contact regarding time with the children if approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment, if able.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Colby Bertell Burr in court with attorney Daniel E. Meylink.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 23.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 23.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Branch 23 is not in session on 3/27/2014. Branch 40, Judge Dallet will hear case from branch 23.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Joann S; Frank S.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Colby Bertell Burr in court with attorney Daniel E. Meylink.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 23.  cmt  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
